DOC.detailed_description: The study prospective randomize clinical control trial among HIV-1 seropositive adult participant begin HAART ( highly active antiretroviral therapy ) first time . Patients eligible initiated HAART UW/Coptic Hope Center Infectious Diseases refer enrollment . Eligible patient refer learn study invite enroll signing write informed consent . Study participant randomize one four arm : educational counseling , pocket alarm device , education alarm , neither . Participants follow study 1 ½ year enrollment randomization . Participants return clinic every month pick renewal antiretroviral prescription time pill count perform . During follow-up visit , blood drawn store CD4 count HIV-1 viral analysis . Within trial , study also propose identify sociodemographic spatial correlate adherence . The study hypothesize educational counseling medication alarm device may significantly improve adherence , poor adherence may associate low socioeconomic standing , increased mobility , distance clinic .
